result.execSummary:
The defendant Greggery A. Hofmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample.

Defendant shall have a GPS monitoring unit installed and the defendant shall pay the costs of the installation of the GPS unit.  Defendant shall undergo any counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

records.addlTxt: for C.R.K.
for Sentencing Hearing held on March 10, 2017

Defendant Greggery A. Hofmann in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Defendant Greggery A. Hofmann in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Tlusty and Attorney Nocco indicates that they received the doctor's report.  Court questions defendant.  Court finds that Mr. Hofmann is competent to proceed. Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights complied with.   Plea of no contest to counts 1 and 2.  Plea colloquy.  Court finds plea freely and voluntarily; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty of counts 1 and 2.  Court orders two years prison; 1 year initial confinement and 1 year extended supervision concurrent to each other and concurrent to any other sentence defendant is serving; 163 days sentence credit; courts costs; DNA SC on count 1; DNA sample; counseling as deemed appropriate; installation of GPS monitoring unit and pay the costs of the installation of the unit.  Appeal rights given to defendant. - rt

Defendant Greggery A. Hofmann in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Defendant Greggery A. Hofmann in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Court orders another competency evaluation.  Court also schedules this matter for another jury trial.  Jury trial scheduled for March 13, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 7, 2017 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Greggery A. Hofmann in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Defendant Greggery A. Hofmann in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Plea of no contest.   Plea colloquy.  Court will adjourn this matter to another date.  Mr. Hofmann is not answering questions put to him regarding his plea.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 9, 2017 at 10:00 am. Regarding Competency
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Greggery A. Hofmann in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Defendant Greggery A. Hofmann in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nocco received the evaluation of Mr. Hofmann and based on the examination is withdrawing the competency claim.  Attorney Nocco could not ascertain Mr. Hofmann's position.  Court receives doctor's report indicating that defendant is competent to proceed.  Attorney Nocco will not be proceeding further with competency.  Court finds Mr. Hofmann is competent to proceed.  Attorney Nocco waives reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Plea of not guilty to all charges.  In Case No. 14CF43.  Court finds defendant is competent.  Attorney Tlusty to prepare order.  Pretrial conference scheduled for January 18, 2017 at 9:15 am.  - rt
by Department of Health Services

Defendant Greggery A. Hofmann in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Defendant Greggery A. Hofmann in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nocco is entering a plea of not guilty on his defendant's behalf.  Attorney Nocco is requesting a competency examination.  Court orders competency examination.  Bond continued.

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall have no contact with C.R.K. - dob: 12-17-90.
Initial Appearance set for October 25, 2016 at 1:00 p.m.
Arrest Report

ADR began at 10:01:34.  Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Greggery A. Hofmann appeared in court, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty request a $1,000.00 cash bond with booking and no contact with C.R.K. - dob:  12-17-1990.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Next court date is October 25, 2016 at 1:00 pm.  ADR ended at 10:10:58 - rt
